attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Having read details on this, I cannot see any redeeming features in implementing this scheme, which looks to not be able to resolve the terrorism/benefit fraud issues it claims, yet instead looks like a hugely cynical way of the first steps towards implementing a big brother state.
Several factors in the scheme concern me deeply.
It strikes me the governent already has passports/driving licenses/NI Cards/Medical Cards/and so on as regards Identity.
Would the Governemt actually conceed in the face of overwhelming public opposition (assuming we still live in a Democratic society) that the scheme is flawed and should be scrapped. 
Or very likely lose power at the next election in protest over this matter, provided the other 2 parties continue to stand firm against the scheme.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
